Our areas of activity are every bit as diverse as our outstanding Bosch teams around the world. Work #LikeABosch• Reinvent yourself: At Bosch, you will evolve.• Discover new directions: At Bosch, you will find your place.• Balance your life: At Bosch, your job matches your lifestyle.• Celebrate success: At Bosch, we celebrate you.• Be yourself: At Bosch, we value values.• Shape tomorrow: At Bosch, you change lives.Job DescriptionWe are seeking a highly motivated and analytical intern to join our Quality team. As a Quality Analytics Intern, you will play a key role in supporting data-driven initiatives to improve product and service quality across the organization. You will work alongside experienced professionals to analyze data, identify trends, and contribute to process improvement projects that align with our commitment to delivering high-quality products and services.Key Responsibilities:Data Analysis: Assist in collecting, cleaning, and analyzing data related to quality metrics, performance indicators, and customer feedback to identify trends and areas for improvement.Report Generation: Support the creation of regular reports, dashboards, and presentations that summarize quality data, trends, and actionable insights for internal stakeholders.Quality Control: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to monitor and assess key quality control processes, such as product inspections, testing, and audits.Process Improvement: Assist in analyzing business processes, identifying inefficiencies, and proposing data-driven solutions to enhance quality standards.Root Cause Analysis: Participate in investigations to identify the root causes of quality issues using statistical tools and analytical techniques.Data Visualization: Use data visualization tools (e.g., Excel, Power BI, Tableau) to create visual representations of quality data, making it easier for stakeholders to interpret.Documentation: Help maintain detailed records of analysis, findings, and improvement initiatives in line with organizational standards and regulatory requirements.Support Team Projects: Work closely with the Quality Analytics team to support ongoing projects, contributing to process optimization and continuous improvement initiatives.QualificationsIntern Program Requirements:GPA of 3.0 or higherActively enrolled in an undergraduate/graduate program OR within 1 year of graduation dateDemonstrate high potential, including suitable academic achievement, extracurricular participation and community serviceEducation and/or Experience:Currently pursuing a bachelor’s or master's degree and be actively enrolled for the duration of your co-op. Area of Study should be from one of the following: EngineeringBusiness AnalyticsStatisticsApplied MathematicsOperations ResearchQuality AssuranceOr relatedRequired Experience:Proficiency in Microsoft ExcelPower BI knowledge is a mustFamiliarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau) is a plus.Competency:Problem SolvingStrong analytical and intellectual skillsCompetent use of systematic problem-solving toolsCommunication SkillsCommunicate with different levels of associates and culturesAbility to work with workshop personnelSelf-starting, results oriented, flexible, team playerAbility to coordinate and manage multiple tasks simultaneouslyMeet deadlines on assigned tasks, utilize project timeline tools, effectively communicate goals and resultsPreferred Qualifications:Experience with statistical software or programming languages such as R, Python, or SQL is a plus.Knowledge of quality management systems (e.g., Six Sigma, ISO 9001) and quality improvement methodologies is an advantage.Additional InformationEqual Opportunity Employer, including disability / veterans Indefinite U.S. work authorized individuals only. Future sponsorship for work authorization is not available.*Bosch adheres to Federal, State, and Local laws regarding drug-testing. Employment is contingent upon the successful completion of a drug screen and background check. Candidates who have been offered the position must pass both screenings before their start date. Your well-being matters at Bosch! We offer a competitive compensation and a benefits package designed to empower you in every area of your life. This includes premium health coverage, a 401(k) with generous matching, resources for financial planning and goal setting, ample paid time off, parental leave, and comprehensive life and disability protection.
